intro: Dampiera candicans, commonly known as the silverleaf dampiera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal heathlands and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. It is a member of the family Scrophulariaceae and is known for its ornamental value. Dampiera candicans is also valued for its ability to attract native pollinators such as bees and birds.
